page.title: 17RECREATION-A DAYS SHOOTING-B
page.content:
(CONTINUED FROM PAGE 16)
FIVE TO THIRTY SHOTS AND ABOUT TWENTY DUCKS FLEW OVER THE TOP OF US.MY DAD SAYS THAT SOMETIMES NEARLY A HUNDRED OR SO DUCKS CAN FLY OVERHEAD.OUR FIRST DRIVE WAS UP BY THE FARM,WHERE A LOT OF PARTRIDGES WERE UP IN THE FAR CORNER.WE GOT OUT A WHITE PIECE OF CLOTH,SO THEY DID'NT FLY OVER US-THIS WORKED SINCE THEY FLEW OVER THE GUNS. SIX PARTRIDGE WERE SHOT,AND THEY WERE RETRIEVED BY THE DOGS. SOME OF MY FRIENDS AND TEACHERS ASK ME HOW I CAN ACTUALLY HELP TO KILL ANIMALS FOR SPORT.I ALWAYS TELL THEM THAT MOST PEOPLE LIKE TO EAT MEAT,AND THAT WE NEVER HAVE ANY DIFFICULTY IN FINDING BUYERS FOR THE BIRDS WE WISH TO SELL. I EARN A GOOD BIT OF MONEY BY BEATING FOR MY DAD AND HIS FRIENDS-SIX POUNDS.
